page.title: 06Education in Canterbury (1)
page.content: Within the Canterbury division there are 11 secondary schools with 8,541 pupils, 40 primary{schools}with 8,540 pupils and 3 special schools with 180 pupils. 912 teachers are employed. In Canterbury itself there are 2 {secondary modern,}1{comprehensive,}1 bi-lateral and 3{grammar schools.} A middle school scheme was adopted by the L.E.A. in 1969 but many new buildings were needed for which the approval was not given. The Conservative government elected in 1979 gave education authorities a choice of either implementing the comprehensive schemes or withdrawing them. Canterbury withdrew their scheme and there are no new plans for comprehensive schooling in Canterbury. However, St.Anselm's - a Roman Catholic Secondary school- is organised as a comprehensive.
